when both were authorized by the United States Congress on October 11, 1974.  Senator Ralph Yarborough was its most powerful proponent in Congress.  The bill that established the 84,550-acre preserve was proposed by Representatives Charlie Wilson and Bob Eckhardt. The Big Thicket was also designated as a Biosphere Reserve by UNESCO in 1981.
The Big Thicket offers many miles of hiking trails, with interpretive signage to inform the visitor about the diverse flora and fauna to be found in this area.  Additionally,
